page.title: 14Transport & services
page.content: A{service bus}runs through Lastingham & Spaunton on Wednesdays & every other Saturday to take people to the local market towns. The same bus also transports the children to schools outside the area. A mini-bus service calls at Cropton once a week. These services & a shared taxi arrangement give independence to those without their own transport. To some,this is the only opportunity to leave the area although car owners are always happy to offer lifts especially for visits to the doctor. Cropton & Lastingham each have one general shop/post office & there is a six day postal service. Milk & newspapers are delivered to the door & mobile vans selling meat,fish & bread call regularly. A mobile library visits the villages once a fortnight. Most people need cars for work & out of village activities.
